intro: Taraxacum amblylepidocarpum, commonly known as the Chinese dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of stiff, hairy leaves and a yellow flower head that develops into a pappus-equipped seed sphere. Native to China, this plant thrives in temperate climates and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical features include a taproot system and a composite flower structure typical of the dandelion genus. The plant is noted for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its potential medicinal uses in traditional Chinese medicine.
